awd_titl_txt: PRF:  The Molecular Genetics of Acoustical Communication in the Cricket Genus Laupala
awd_abstract_narration: The development of new molecular genetic and statistical                        techniques provides the opportunity to identify the number and                  genomic position of quantitative trait loci (QTL's) through                     linkage associations of variable molecular markers.  These new                  techniques  will be applied to a hybridization study of two                     species of crickets in the genus Laupala: L.paranigra and                       L.kohalaensis.  These species posess an extremely simple                        acoustical communication system.  Phenotypic variation in female                phonotaxis will be associated to specific QTL's in a hybrid                     backcross design.  These results will be compared to those                      obtained from another study on the male calling song in order to                test competing models of genetic architecture of character                      covariation.
